description:
The perfect weed-fighting duo

Eliminate weeds both on and off your lawn with these complementary formulas.

Dandelion Doom's iron-based formula kills broadleaf weeds, moss, and algae in lawns while leaving grass unharmed, plus Weed Warrior's organic herbicidal soap eliminates all vegetation in as little as 20 minutes on patios, paths, and garden beds. Both ready-to-use spray bottles make spot-treating simple with no mixing required. Together, they provide a complete weed management system without harsh chemicals.

sections.product_features:
Two specialized weed control formulas
Lawn-safe option for broadleaf weeds
Fast-acting organic formula for gardens
Ready-to-use spray bottles - no mixing
Controls dozens of weeds and moss
See results in as little as 20 minutes
No harsh chemicals
sections.whats_included:
One 32 oz. bottle of Dandelion Doom iron chelated (FeHEDTA) selective weed killer
One 32 oz. bottle of Weed Warrior organic herbicidal soap non-selective weed killer
sections.instructions:
For best results, apply between 50-85 degrees F when no rain is expected for 3+ hours:
Shake bottles well before using and adjust nozzles to desired spray pattern
For lawn weeds: Use Dandelion Doom directly on weeds until leaves are entirely covered
For garden/hardscape weeds: Use Weed Warrior on unwanted vegetation, avoiding desirable plants
Allow products to dry completely before any foot traffic
Repeat Weed Warrior in 2-3 weeks and Dandelion Doom in 3-4 weeks for tough weeds if needed
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Lawn Advisors:
What's the difference between Sunday’s weed killers?
Dandelion Doom is selective - it kills broadleaf weeds while leaving grass unharmed, making it perfect for lawn use. Weed Warrior is non-selective - it kills all vegetation it contacts including grass, making it ideal for hardscapes and garden beds.
What weeds does Dandelion Doom control?
It's effective against broadleaf weeds like dandelion, clover, chickweed, plantain, thistle, creeping charlie, and many more. It also controls moss, algae, and lichens while suppressing lawn diseases like dollar spot, rust and snow mold.
What vegetation does Weed Warrior control?
It effectively eliminates bluegrass, chickweed, crabgrass, corn spurry, dandelion, groundsel, lambsquarters, mouse-eared chickweed, mustards, plantain, redroot pigweed, round leaved mallow, sheep sorrel, shepherd's-purse, stinkweed, thistle, moss, algae, and lichens.
Does Dandelion Doom stain?
Yes, it can cause staining due to high iron content. Avoid using on sidewalks, concrete, or other hard surfaces. If you accidentally spill, immediately spray and dilute the area with water.
How quickly will I see results?
Weed Warrior works extremely fast - often showing results in as little as 20 minutes or up to 24 hours depending on plant size. Dandelion Doom typically shows results within hours, with complete control in 1-2 days.
Are there any US states where this is not approved for use?
This product is approved for use in all states.
